An All-Male Film Panel Met PM Modi To Discuss Nation Building, People Ask Where Are The Women?
An All-Male Film Panel Met PM Modi To Discuss Nation Building, People Ask Where Are The Women?
Last evening a panel of people including Aamir Khan, Rajkumar Hirani, Aanand L Rai, Ritesh Sidhwani, Siddharth Roy Kapur, Maulik Bhagat, and Mahaveer Jain met PM Modi to discuss how the entertainment industry can contribute more in nation-building.
The picture was posted by Film critic and business analyst Taran Adarsh and has gone viral on the internet in less than 24 hours. Can you guess why?
Hon Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi meets film industry delegation: Aamir Khan, Rajkumar Hirani, Aanand L Rai, Ritesh Sidhwani, Siddharth Roy Kapur, Maulik Bhagat and Mahaveer Jain... How entertainment industry can contribute more in nation building was discussed. pic.twitter.com/VKbWvhqnso — taran adarsh (@taran_adarsh) October 25, 2018
Well, the outrage over this picture built up when people spotted that this panel didn't include even one single woman from the film industry.
"Where is Rima Das? Her movie is going for Oscars and she has not been included? wrote one user.
Other users pointed out how this panel can discuss nation building and development without a single woman in sight.
Don't Miss 837 SHARES 3.6 K SHARES 193 SHARES
Today, when we talk about women empowerment and feminism, it is shocking and sad to see that no woman could make the cut in the list of members of the panel. This picture triggered a lot of anger and angst among people who couldn't stop but asking, "Where are the women?".
In case you are wondering what made the netizens angry today, these tweets sum up the reason well.
Aamir and other male representatives from Bollywood met PM Modi to discuss issues plaguing the industry. The manel was very successful and the lack of female representation was not noticeable. pic.twitter.com/Ec6UAJHmL5 — Shilpa Rathnam (@shilparathnam) October 26, 2018
Not even a single women there! This pic is from industry which portrays itself as forefront of equality and social justice! — Vinay (@vnay_85) October 25, 2018
